tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 釜座通（かまんざどおり）は京都市の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Kamanza-dori is a north-south street in Kyoto City.
The Kamanza-dori is a street running north-south street in Kyoto City.
The Kamanza-dori Street is a street running north-south street in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は下立売通から、南は三条通までの1.2km。
sen.e: It runs from the Shimotachiuri-dori Street in the north to the Sanjo-dori Street in the south.
It runs from Shimotachiuri-dori Street in the north to Sanjo-dori Street in the south.
It runs from Shimotachiuri-dori Street in the north to Sanjo-dori Street in the south for 1.2km.

sen.j: 下立売通と丸太町通の間は京都府の正面にあたり、街路樹をもつ幅の広い道である。
sen.e: The section between the Shimotachiuri-dori Street and the Marutamachi-dori Street, which runs straight ahead from the Kyoto Prefectural Government building, is a wide road having roadside trees.
The section between Shimotachiuri-dori Street and Marutamachi-dori Street, which runs straight ahead from the Kyoto Prefectural Government building, is wide and lined with trees.
The section between Shimotachiuri-dori Street and Marutamachi-dori Street, which runs straight ahead from the Kyoto Prefectural Government building, is wide and lined with trees.

sen.j: 丸太町通から南は北行の一方通行の狭い道となる。
sen.e: The section south of the Marutamachi-dori Street is one-way traffic heading north.
The section south of Marutamachi-dori Street consists of one-way northbound traffic.
The section south of Marutamachi-dori Street consists of one-way northbound traffic.

sen.j: また南へ延長した線上の仏光寺通と七条通の間には若宮通がある。
sen.e: Along the extension of the Kamanza-dori, the Wakamiya-dori Street runs between the Shichijo-dori Street and the Shichijo-dori Street.
Along the extension of the Kamanza-dori, Wakamiya-dori Street runs between Shichijo-dori Street and Shichijo-dori Street.
Along the extension of the Kamanza-dori Street, Wakamiya-dori Street runs between Shichijo-dori Street and Shichijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 平安京には存在せず、豊臣秀吉の京都改造（天正の地割）後に作られた道である。
sen.e: The Kamanza-dori, which did not exist in Heiankyo, was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in his Kyoto restructuring plan (Tensho zoning).
Kamanza-dori, which did not exist in Heiankyo, was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during his Kyoto restructuring plan (Tensho zoning).
Kamanza-dori Street, which did not exist in Heiankyo, was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during his Kyoto restructuring plan (Tensho zoning).

sen.j: 平安時代から現在の三条釜座近辺に、釜師（茶釜などの鋳物職人）が住む「釜座」（かまんざ）が集まっていたことからこの名がある。
sen.e: The name "Kamanza" comes from many foundry men (artisans who made iron goods such as iron kettles) who lived around present-day Sanjogamaza during the Heian period.
The name "Kamanza" comes from many foundry men (artisans who made iron goods such as iron kettles) who lived around present-day Sanjogamaza during the Heian period.
The name 'Kamanza' comes from many foundry men (artisans who made iron goods such as iron kettles) who lived around present-day Sanjogamaza during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 現在もその地に1軒だけ釜師がある。
sen.e: Only one foundry remains there today.
Only one foundry remains there today.
Only one foundry remains there today.

sen.j: 京都府庁・京都府警察
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Government and Kyoto Prefectural Police
Kyoto Prefectural Government and Kyoto Prefectural Police
Kyoto Prefectural Government and Kyoto Prefectural Police
Kyoto Second Red Cross Hospital
Kyoto Second Red Cross Hospital
Kyoto Second Red Cross Hospital
Kyoto City Kamigyo Fire Department
Kyoto City Kamigyo Fire Department
Kyoto City Kamigyo Fire Department

sen.j: 京都市中京消防署-梅屋消防分団
sen.e: Kyoto City Nakagyo Fire Department, Umeya Fire Squad
Kyoto City Nakagyo Fire Department, Umeya Fire Squad
Kyoto City Nakagyo Fire Department, Umeya Fire Squad

sen.j: 梅屋広場（旧京都市立梅屋小学校跡）
sen.e: Umeya Hiroba (former Kyoto City Umeya Elementary School)
Umeya Hiroba (former Kyoto City Umeya Elementary School)
Umeya Hiroba (former Kyoto City Umeya Elementary School)
Bank of Kyoto Fuchomae Branch

Bank of Kyoto Fuchomae Branch

sen.j: 大西清右衛門 - 三条釜座の京釜師
sen.e: Seiemon ONISHI - a Kyoto foundry man at Sanjogamaza
Seiemon ONISHI - a Kyoto foundry man at Sanjogamaza
Seiemon ONISHI - a Kyoto foundry man at Sanjogamaza
